revision.comment: Central Nahuatl: correct misformatted language section divider at end; Central Nahuatl: correct whitespace of section 0
revision.text: ==Central Nahuatl== ===Alternative forms=== * {{sense|Tlaxcala}} {{l|nhn|xajkal}} ===Noun=== {{head|nhn|noun}} # [[hut]]. [[Category:Amecameca Central Nahuatl]] {{c|nhn|Architecture}} ---- ==Classical Nahuatl== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|nci|xacalli}} ===Etymology=== Possibly ''*xahtli'' "thatch (?)" + '''[[calli#Classical_Nahuatl|calli]]''' "house". ''Xahcalli'' is the source of Spanish and English ''[[jacal]]'', and possibly of English ''[[shack]]''. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nci|/ʃaʔkalli/}} ===Noun=== {{head|nci|nouns}} # A [[jacal]]; a [[hut]] made with [[pole]]s and [[thatch]]. ===References=== * Andrews, J. Richard. (2003) ''Workbook for Introduction to Classical Nahuatl, Revised Edition'', Univeristy of Oklahoma Press, p. 263. * Karttunen, Frances. (1983) ''An Analytical Dictionary of Nahuatl'', University of Texas Press, p. 321. * Lockhart, James. (2001) ''Nahuatl as Written'', Stanford University Press, p. 241.
